verses.roman:
ei ślokera artha kahi saṅkṣepera sāra
bhaktera icchāya kṛṣṇera sarva avatāra

synonyms: ei—this; ślokera—of the verse; artha—the meaning; kahi—I relate; saṅkṣepera—of conciseness; sāra—the pith; bhaktera—of the devotee; icchāya—by the desire; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; sarva—all; avatāra—incarnations.
translation: The essence of the meaning of this verse is that Lord Kṛṣṇa appears in all His innumerable eternal forms because of the desires of His pure devotees.
